author: {'steamid': '76561198061193880', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1623893073}
review:
The gold standard for modern "traditional" boomer shooters (aka ones that closely emulate the game feel of the classics instead of adding new things like ULTRAKILL), IMO. It has the feels of something like Quake in its aesthetics and gameplay, but with 20 years of advancements in game design and engine capabilities that make it so much better than Quake that it almost renders it obsolete.

Like I said, this is THE definitive callback shooter that I compare all others against.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014506654', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 527, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1712324619}
review: Dusk is an excellent fast paced FPS with a large dose of horror in it. Dusk takes around 7 hours to beat, it's similar to Quake and Doom from the fast gameplay to the rocking soundtrack, all it's elements amalgamated to Dusk being a great retro FPS, I would especially recommend Dusk to anyone who loves's boomer shooters or FPS's in general, Dusk is a game that you should play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070369714', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1703788085}
review:
Such a great game, throughout all three chapters.

Chapter 1 was a bit more simplistic but I think it worked in the games sake because I imagine it was intended to give the player a bit of breathing room to learn the basic mechanics of the game before the game gets crazy.

Chapter 2 was probably my favorite out of the three because of how variety there was in the different levels and the level design and flow of those levels were excellent, The Grainery, Infernal Machine and Escher Labs are examples of being genuinely perfect.

Chapter 3 upped the ante with how crazy and Lovecraftian the game gets and while I don't think the levels were as good as the second episode, its very close and all the levels in chapter 3 are all mostly very memorable and do a perfect build up from the last two chapters.

The game's sandbox and enemies are all very fun to use/fight, the only two enemies I think are kind of lame are the Grand Wizards (the red mages that shoot projectiles that track you) and the bone ball. An enemy that I loved fighting was the Wendigo though, I loved the mechanic with having to look down to find its footsteps and also hear its breathing while it gets close and if you shoot it, it reveals itself from being invisible, such good shit.

A lot of this game is what I wanted Quake to be when I played it more than a year ago, this game all across the board is near perfect and was so fucking fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561199048139541', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1709493893}
review:
Dusk is so freaking cool, the blood, the guns, the spinning guns, the enemies, the bosses, everything is coming together in the best way possible, the amount of stuff in this game is crazy, this game is a must-play for anyone who enjoys retro first person shooters or anything of the sort. This game is WORTH your money and it is WORTH your time, you won't regret it.
The game offers the following:
- A campaign mode with multiple environments and tons of levels
- Secret levels to find and explore
- Cool and satisfying guns (THEY SPIN)
- You can do a back AND a front flip
- There is an endless mode with a multitude of maps to choose from
- BANGER SOUNDTRACK AND MUSIC!
- Scary enemies and various entities (rats)
- Free HD textures for people who don't like the retro look
- Free goodies that have insight to the games' development
- Free multiplayer mode and character editor to have fun HL: Deathmatch style
- More secrets, lizards or something
- Level editor with CUSTOM MUSIC
+ AND A LOT MORE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037741353', 'num_games_owned': 1752, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 568, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1711648161}
review:
Fast, fluid, and fun, Dusk is sure to entertain fans of late-'90s shooters, in particular Quake and Unreal Tournament. Featuring 3 Episodes with 11 levels each (including a secret mission for each episode), there winds up being a decent amount of content. I'd say there's roughly 6-8 hours worth depending on how many secrets you seek out. I was able to double that time via a second playthrough on DUSK HD, which is a free overhaul that acts as a separate game in the main launcher. Kind of a bummer that my progress from the base game didn't carry over, but I didn't mind much as I took the opportunity to wipe out any achievements I was missing.

While ostensibly a horror game, such elements wind up falling by the wayside when you get to Episode 2. It was a little disappointing for me because I really enjoyed the atmosphere of Episode 1, but later on into it it started to remind me a little bit of American McGee's Alice in terms of level design and aesthetic, which wound up winning me over. Luckily things wrapped back around to the horror setting of the first episode by the end of it all, and I gotta say I was pleasantly surprised with some of the newer mechanics introduced in 3.

Definitely pick this up if you're interested in the resurgence of boomer shooters. I feel like this game led the charge on it all, and in a lot of ways it still comes out ahead. Well worth the $20.

review:
one of the greatest boomer shooters of all time. Dusk might even be better than the games that inspired it.

+ exceptional movement, great weapons, good boss mechanics, sound design and music, yet simple straightforward game-play.

+ the game doesn't feel repetitive because of level design, especially in acts 2 and 3.

Make sure to disable bloom in the video settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041165175', 'num_games_owned': 1769, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1710913624}
review:
There isn’t anything that stands out as being all that great in my eyes about Dusk. Initially, I tried the game several years ago and refunded it because it didn't feel like there was anything special there. I felt I was going through the motions of playing another FPS.  

However, upon seeing the recent release of the HD version I was tempted to give it another go. I’m not upset that I did but my perspective on the game has only slightly changed. Visually, I like the newer look substantially more than the original muddy textured version of the game. This improvement upped my enjoyment quite a lot.

Gameplay-wise, when playing through chapters I found myself fluctuating between enjoyment and annoyance. I think this primarily has to do with level design. Certain stages are pretty great. Specifically, I like the stages composed of a larger space that is then connected to several smaller segmented-off areas. There is a nice feeling of openness to them and the exploration of finding the various keys to unlock and progress to the next sections flows nicely. 

In contrast, some stages or sections are primarily made of corridors or smaller restrictive spaces. When forced into these areas for too long my enjoyment would wane. When the fun of the game is tied to fast movement, jumping around, and blasting away at enemies it's unpleasant to be crammed up in small spaces for too long. I feel like some fat could have likely been trimmed here and that these segments were added for variety's sake and game length rather than prioritizing condensed fun.

I also have to mention, I despised the two or three different, albeit short moments, where you are just essentially wandering around in the dark. They are so annoying. Also, the stages for “Chapter 3” start off so strong and are rather awesome but a select few of the last ones are, in contrast, so weak.

Enemy and environmental variety are pretty solid throughout the entire game. It’s engaging to see a new area and kill a new creature who has a slightly different movement. 

A disappointing detail that stood out to me is that in the challenging arena-like areas you can often just back up to the nearest halfway and funnel enemies into it rather than forcing the player to kill the enemies in the actual area. Locking a player out of this option by closing a door temporarily as they enter into these areas may have created a more challenging and rewarding experience and required them to leverage power-ups more advantageously.

Overall, despite complaining so much about that game I ultimately think it’s okay. It’s a hard one to dislike. It’s smooth, fast, and varied with different enemies and levels but I just find it to be a bit plain and could have benefited from trimming a few weaker stages.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983779684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 638, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1712470837}
review:
I absolutely adore the original Quake, but DUSK might actually be even better. The main reason is that the level designs are INSANELY good. There's an incredible slow burn of tension, complexity and surreal atmosphere that builds throughout the entire game.

For example, there's a level called the Escher Labs. When you first start the level, it looks just like a bland boxy office, and you're a bit disappointed. After going around a few corners, there is now furniture on the ceiling and impossible geometry making up the layout, and you realize the designer pulled a fast one on you. It's f****** great.

11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199175290775', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1710740833}
review:
Que juegazo honestamente, Dusk es de los mejores boomers shooters que he jugado hasta la fecha, por no decir el mejor, este juego es tan variado, tan frenético y a la vez tan adictivo que es imposible no recomendarlo, es como un sucesor espiritual de Blood pero con muchas más mecánicas, un diseño de niveles increíble, una música genial, super metalera e intensa, y unos episodios que cada vez se van poniendo mejores y más intensos,  uno nunca se cansa de jugarlo y quiere seguir hasta terminarlo por completo, también hay partes donde el juego genuinamente da miedo y que te ponen en una tensión increíble, los gráficos son muy buenos apesar de ser low poly y la dirección artística es buenísima y recuerda mucho al ya mencionado Blood pero en HD, la variedad de armas y enemigos es bastante amplia incluso para este tipo de juegos, por lo que gracias a eso y a la introducción de nuevas mecánicas a cada rato lo que lo hace que no te puedas aburrir de jugarlo, el episodio 3 es el más intenso y el más variado de todos, y la batalla final es muy memorable.
Lo único malo diría yo es el nivel 7 del episodio 3 que es bastante molesto con la mecánica de cambiar de dirección, estuve como 40 minutos atascado en esa parte, no sé a quién se le ocurrió semejante cosa.
Pero en fin, Dusk es genial e infinitamente mejor que el sobrevalorado de Ultrakill

review: Мегафаново и пафосно, при первом прохождении хоть и была нубиком, но ошышела от жизни, советую. Еще нравится своеобразность мультиплеера, он хоть и мертвый (как минимум днем, ночью он может быть и получше, когда из-за разницы по времени американцы какие оживают), но с другой стороны когда играешь с 1-2 людьми которых таки повезло найти, можно реально запомнить их и с большим шансом встретить потом, довольно локально короче в отличие от всяких там кс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181052735', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1711134367}
review:
[h1] Качество не в картинке, а в геймплее [/h1]
Даск не повернется язык назвать паразитом на чувствах от старых шутеров. Это самостоятельный представитель жанра, который даже для меня стал неожиданностью. 
Нарочито плохая графика компенсируется драйвом перестрелок и обилием интересных врагов и уровней. Игра как подчерпывает фишки из кваки и дума ( дичайше полезная, но простая в освоении распрыжка, мрачные монструозные враги  и лютый боевой музон), так и вносит свои элементы ( очень полезные подкат и батуты, добавляющие скорости в геймплей, хорорные уровни без фонарикам и вездесущим дыханием врага в темноте ). Про левел дизайн вообще отдельно - если в первой, отчасти второй главе - локации вполне обычные, то далее архитектура и логика мира искренне поражают воображение.
Враги не являются разным спрайтом, а каждый требует к себе особого подхода. Особенно запомнилась невидимая тварь, заставляющая слегка истерично расстреливать воздух в её поиске ( особенно в узком пространстве). Боссфайты не особо радуют, но финальный босс вполне себе хорош. 
Плюсом идут различные рофлы, неуместные, но от того забавные механики сна, алкоголя и еды, хотя вот сигара уже добавит +100 к крутости. 
Игра достойна своих денег и вашего внимания, проходится быстро и на одном дыхании. Из минусов я бы только выделил не особо удобное колесо выбора оружия и меч в третьей главе ( пососный и наxyй не нужный)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970395722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1709994007}
review:
Dusk stands out as an excellent boomer shooter, showcasing a simplicity that doesn't compromise its quality. The weapons deliver a satisfying feel, and the enemy design is both classic and diverse. However, its standout feature is undoubtedly the level design. With approximately 30 missions, each can be completed swiftly, usually taking only 5-10 minutes, yet they boast incredible intricacy. Whether you find yourself in crypts, cornfields, or demonic industrial areas, each level is a dynamic experience.

The game keeps you on your toes as floors unexpectedly give way, revealing massive shafts to navigate, only to be propelled back to the surface by jumpers. Levels undergo remarkable transformations, shifting in front of your eyes or flipping on their axis to become something entirely new. Every level is rife with secrets, and the environmental storytelling is well done. Despite the minimalistic use of props, the game creates a powerful atmosphere with otherworldly messages scrawled in blood on the walls, claustrophobic lighting that only illuminates a narrow path, and a cryptic narrator urging you to interact with the surroundings.

Dusk captures the classic 3D Realms aesthetic with its ultraviolent, crunchy palettes. To complement the intense gameplay, the soundtrack is nothing short of fantastic. It draws inspiration from Mick Gordon's work on Doom, yet offers a subtler demonic atmospheric ambience in contrast to Mick's iconic industrial guitars and heavy bass. In the realm of modern-day boomer shooters, Dusk undeniably earns its place among the greats.

review:
Fun game, wish it had autosaves at the beginning of the level so when I make the mistake of exiting, I don't feel some requirement to play the whole chapter up to that point again.

On the other hand though, there is a level select for the ones you have played and the maps feel like they might be paced best if you started with no guns and picked them up each time. The few times I did that, it turned out quite fun.

Dusk is fun and worth a shot. Amid Evil reigns as my favorite from New Blood so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282148408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1709666009}
review:
Un gioco INCREDIBILE!
DUSK è uno FPS con elementi horror uscito nel 2018, chiaramente ispirato agli sparatutto degli anni 90. La sua bellezza raggiunge vette altissime dovute a vari fattori che lo rendono unico e riconoscibile in un mercato dove il genere è saturo fino al midollo.

Lo shooting si attesta su buonissimi livelli: veloce ed adrenalinico, un buonissimo gunplay che permette di ottenere una grande soddisfazione durante gli scontri più intensi. Son presenti una miriade di bocche da fuoco (e non solo) utili per ogni occasione. Giocato alla difficoltà più alta è veramente una sfida ardua da masochisti ma fattibile se si entra nel mood.
Il gioco alterna momenti "alla doom" a momenti leggermente più "calmi", dove la sua natura horror prende il sopravvento, regalando momenti inquietanti ed ispirati. 

E' diviso in 3 episodi formati da 11 livelli (10 principali ed uno segreto). I livelli sono di una bellezza più unica che rara: design quasi eccellente mista ad un'atmosfera veramente ben riuscita! I livelli sono divertentissimi da esplorare e giocare, mai banali o riciclati. Veramente ben fatto!
A mio modo di vedere, il terzo episodio "The namless city" credo sia un capolavoro dal punto di vista di design e messa in scena.
A ciò si può aggiungere la lore macabra e la narrazione volutamente minimale, mi son piaciute molto. Certo, ovviamente son sempre un "pretesto" per poter maciullare orde di nemici, ma son comunque interessanti a loro modo e, la voce che ci accompagnerà durante l'avventura e le scritte trovate in giro con frasi enigmatiche, renderanno tutto più angosciante. 

Presente anche del completismo, oltre al semplice trovare tutti i segreti e uccidere tutti i nemici. Vi sono altri 3 "premi" legati al non uccidere nessun nemico, non farsi mai colpire e finire il livello nel minor tempo possibile. Naturalmente è impossibile ottenere tutto in un unica run, ma bisognerà rifare il livello più volte. 

Nota sulle ost: sublimi. Le musiche ambientali sono perfette e inquietanti mentre le musiche degli scontri sono adrenaliniche e pompose. Sono incredibili e vi consiglio di ascoltarle per bene.

Inoltre è stata creata un "remastered" a costo 0, scaricabile e che consiglio caldamente: migliora praticamente tutto ciò che è legato alla grafica, rendendola molto piacevole.

L'unico punto negativo che mi sento di dare è la presenza di boss poco impattanti e a mio parere abbastanza dimenticabili. 

PRO:
- Estremamente divertente
- Macabro ed inquietante 
- OST assurda
- Level design rasenta l'eccellenza
- DUSK HD migliora di moltissimo il gioco graficamente ed è gratis
- Longevo e rigiocabile

CONTRO:
- Boss fight abbastanza dimenticabili

Dusk è una perla veramente di pregevole fattura, si vede che è stato fatto da qualcuno che ama questo genere di gioco ed è forse uno dei migliori sparatutto degli ultimi anni. Inoltre verrà aggiunto il supporto al workshop, permettendoci di giocare mappe o addirittura nuovi episodi. Perciò giocatelo immediatamente e godetene di ogni singolo pixel: una meraviglia!

Voto: 9

review:
Typowy boomer shooter, czyli niemal zero fabuły, szybka rozgrywka, dużo przeciwników, gore. Jeśli nie razi was kanciasta grafika (również w wersji HD) i lekko drewniana mechanika to polecam. 
Jest również nawiązanie do mitologii Cthulhu Lovecrafta a to zawsze +1 do atrakcyjności. ;-)
Ja się bardzo dobrze bawiłem, polecam.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961703807', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1709516753}
review: Excellent old-school FPS! It exceeded my expectations in every aspect. I had so much fun playing it, I couldn't stop. Even my kids were completely mesmerized by it. They sat and watched me play through the entire game over the span of two days. It does such a great job of capturing the feeling of the classic FPSs (DOOM, Quake, and Half-Life). The exploration, gunplay, sounds, storyline all work together so perfectly that you become completely immersed in the game. I played it on medium difficulty with the old pixelated graphics so I could get the true feel of the game, now I need to play through it again with the HD graphics on hard mode to experience the next level of this game's beautifully perfect chaos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061431259', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1710080677}
review:
This game is amazing. The best of pure boomer shooters. It's very simple, yet masterfully crafted. It has a raw, brutal quality that is hard to put into words. Weapons feel great to shoot, all of them have a lot of utility even in the late game and some provide very interesting movement mechanics and shortcuts, like the Riveter and the Crossbow. Map design present in most levels is just superb, there's a ton of iconic envronments, fun secret areas and unexpected twists and turns you just can't see coming - from dark, rainy farmlands to steampunk shrines floating in the sky. Soundtrack perfectly encapsulates both the atmosphere and visceral action of gameplay, Dusk wouldn't be the same without it. Combat is quick and elegant with varied enemies and a lot of projectiles to avoid. Movement system doesn't have a lot of depth, but is still very satisfying - strafe jumping is insanely fast, letting you dash across arenas and environments like a crackhead; not to mention powerful jump pads. There are some hidden movement mechanics, but aside from speedruns they're not really useful.

My only real issue with the game is the fact that half of Act 1 levels are kinda boring and don't look that great. It's clear those maps have been designed at the very beginning and it's a shame they haven't been reworked to match the quality of later chapters. Also, maybe it's a personal preference, but after hundreds of hours of Doom Eternal and Turbo Overkill, the combat might feel a litlle too easy and shallow at times, mostly due to pretty one-note enemies. But aside from that, Dusk is still a great experience, unrivaled in terms of pure boomer shooters to this day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972258239', 'num_games_owned': 2173, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1709335416}
review:
Der erste Abschnitt von Dusk konnte mich gar nicht begeistern und ich war eigentlich kurz davor, das Spiel abzubrechen. Die Abschnitte zwei und drei haben mir dann aber deutlich mehr Spaß gemacht. Klar, das Spielprinzip ist sehr simpel und an alte Shooter angelehnt, man sucht also quasi die ganze Zeit nach Schlüsseln und den passenden Türen und geht zum nächsten Abschnitt weiter.

Es gibt verschiedene Gegnertypen und eine breite Palette an Waffen und Extras (Zeit verlangsamen, Speed-Boost) sorgen für Abwechslung. Unfaire oder zu schwere Abschnitte habe ich nicht erlebt. Auch die Bosskämpfe waren gut zu schaffen. Hängt aber vielleicht vom gewählten Schwierigkeitsgrad ab.

Probleme hatte ich allerdings mit der Performance, zumindest anfangs. Trotz guter Hardware war Dusk für mich eine ziemliche Ruckelorgie. Warum es dann später besser bzw. gut wurde, weiß ich nicht. Möglicherweise hat der Wechsel Fullscreen > Window > Fullscreen das Problem gelöst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027821997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1709346908}
review:
An incredibly well-done game that brings all the speed and exploration of Quake into a darker, more sinister setting. Tons of secrets, tons of legitimate surprises. Weapons don't feel incredible (so, they feel like Quake... a little soft by modern standards), but figuring out your ammo conservation and efficient use while still being prepped for ambushes is probably better than Quake's heavy ammo supply and way more shotgun shells you ever need. At higher difficulties starts to feel more and more like survival horror, with incredibly high enemy damage output. Just stumbling into an invisible Wendigo will definitely kill you if you can't dodge around. Balance is fantastic. Medium is nice and easy for old timers but rougher on the new guys, medium-hard can be rough, and Duskmare is just... good luck. 

And, of course, the music is excellent. Nicely atmospheric most of the time, sometimes grinding into an awesome metal melody, then sliding back down into ambiance when the action is over. 

If you're into slightly higher res, the Dusk HD free update pack works great. Things do look much better, even if it kinda takes some of the brutal charm out. but then, you can also sling things the other way, go hardcore pixellated. And it's always optional, so you get to pick your visuals. That's awesome. 

I've given probably four copies of this away at this point. Honestly one of my top 5 FPS ever, and sometimes my number 1... just depends on if I want a panic inducing horror themed thing that toppled Quake and Blood for me or if I want the insanity of PBDoom.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968587499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1709263086}
review:
I'm late to the boomer shooter revolution, but I now see why Dusk is considered foundational in the genre.  The short answer: the level design is brilliant.  After playing through all three episodes, if I were to make a ranking of the most memorable FPS levels, Dusk would easily have several entries in the top ten.  The experience is varied from claustrophobic corridors to combat arenas to wide open spaces.  The environmental storytelling is top notch.  As the game progresses, the aesthetics of the environments change significantly and in interesting ways.  Just superb.

Secondly, and this is more a matter of taste, but I adore the horror-pastiche-as-theme vibe that Dusk exudes.    I caught references to Texas Chainsaw Massacre, The Witch and H.P. Lovecraft.  I'm sure there are many more references which went over my head.

However, it's not all sunshine and roses -- er, I mean, bloodstains and meathooks.

The weapons are... fine.  Pistols, shotgun, super shotgun, assault rifle.  You've seen all these before.  There are no secondary fire modes beyond 'look down scope'.  The most interesting weapons here are the shoot-through-walls crossbow and the sword which can charge and parry.  The most fun weapon is the mortar launcher, whose rounds can be detonated mid-air with a secondary click. 

The boss fights are merely perfunctory.  You'll not find more here than a fat health bar and a mess of bullets to dodge.  See 'Turbo Overkill' for a more recent entry which managed to do more to make boss fights interesting within the genre.

The final two levels of the game have a difficulty spike which seems a bit rough.  A late difficulty spike is certainly not unheard of for shooters, and you can adjust the difficulty setting at any time, so not a big deal, but it did put a slight blemish on an otherwise flawless level progression for me.

Still, despite my criticisms, I absolutely recommend a playthrough.  Dusk is worth it.

review:
Рофло-шутан от разработчиков Ultrakill
Сделано добротно, не стыдно играть. В начале когда ты начинаешь прохождение, думаешь что всю игру будешь бегать по полям и отстреливать каких-то Ку-клукс-клановцев, но нет, с каждым уровнем игра тебе дает понять что дальше тебя ждет полнейшее рубилово. Есть куча секреток щедро раскиданных по карте, так что есть чем заняться помимо вытаскивания кишков 10 минут серпами

author: {'steamid': '76561199122563456', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1709218954}
review: Я даже не знаю, что и сказать. Тут не докопаться, игра хороша во всём. Могу выделить что помимо ультранасилия тут ещё и интерактив в виде всяких секретов, мест или вещей. Оружие мне тоже понравилось, особенно меч. Ну и мобы сами по себе крутые, можно убивать тех самых приведений, которые собирались в стайки и угнетали кого-то там. Хотя есть и вариант обосраться, например Виндиго с невидимостью или плевальщик херни в 3 эпизоде. Игру пройти стоит, как минимум за визуал и хороший геймплей.

author: {'steamid': '76561199575733816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1709342118}
review:
Note that I beat DUSK on the second hardest difficulty.

DUSK is a shooter that pays homage to Blood and Quake and takes it's horror even more seriously, even though the protagonist is better equipped to deal with the horde than Caleb is, on account of the lack of hit-scanners (or rather, your ability to dodge bullets). Non of the enemies really irritated me, and they are all well balanced, with probably the most annoying one being the rats. As a matter of fact, it's horror atmosphere means that the Wendigos, a rough equivalent to specters, shine through and can get away with being 99% invisible. Thankfully, DUSK's guns feel pretty good to use and are appropriately balanced. The pistols are decently powerful and good for saving ammo at range or exposing aforementioned Wendigos, and shotguns admittedly fall off in the third episode but still a decent all purpose weapon with range to match, and shoot at a more fluid rate than the Super Shotgun, which might just be the slowest Sawn Off I've ever seen. Even so, it packs a wallop and will rightfully kill most enemies in around two hits, especially at close range. Then you have the assault rifle, which is good for hosing down groups of enemies, and the two explosive launchers, which are great for dealing even heavier damage to a crowd of enemies, and the long range weapons, which have decent ammo and either good zoom, or piercing properties. You even have a sword which I admittedly got less use out of due to the abundance of ammo. Dusk's armory honestly has that issue where your three main weapons are more than enough, but I'd rather that than a bunch of weapons trying way to hard to emulate the standard fps armory and rip off Heretic and Hexen at the same time. The story isn't much, but the main character definitely has more depth than The Champion, if you can believe it; even has a backstory that I'm not spoiling, and that goes for the plot, although I will say that "Dusk Dude" definitely has a lot of Caleb in him, and if you played that game, you can probably see how the game sets up a sequel. The bosses are admittedly just larger versions of enemies, for the (most) part, but lets just say that someone really liked Platinum's bosses. I will say that aside from a few set pieces, it doesn't really try anything new, but what it does do, it does wonderfully. If you like Quake and Blood, buy it! If you don't, or are looking for something more innovative, buy ULTRAKILL instead. Or be like me and buy the bundle, which might be discounted!

author: {'steamid': '76561198871194754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1709524351}
review:
This game is great! It combines the fast and dangerous action of classic shooters like Doom with unique gameplay. This is not surprising. The design is perfect and full of challenges to keep in touch. Let's talk about music. Very well! This soundtrack is the perfect soundtrack for any adrenaline rush.

Of course the game is creative. All models are very interesting, from scary monsters to spooky places. What about enemies? They are very dangerous. Each one is more challenging and fun than the last, which is a real sign of not poor game design.

But what makes this game unique is its story. Rich, interesting. As the game progresses, you will discover many secrets and puzzles that will keep you engaged till the end.

If you pass Doom's Gate, you can't miss this game.

review:
Dusk is one of those arena shooters that takes you by surprise, I went in completely blind and some of these first encounters with enemies were terrifying as hell. The loadout and pace of the game is comfortable, I'll admit though that many secrets are waaaaay easier to find than most others.

Other than that, a genuinely awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990094367', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1709057639}
review:
Rating: 4.7/5

Dusk, developed by David Szymanski and published by New Blood Interactive, emerges as a love letter to classic first-person shooters, delivering a thrilling and nostalgic experience that pays homage to the genre's golden age while injecting it with modern sensibilities.

From the moment you step into the eerie world of Dusk, you're transported back to the 1990s, greeted by pixelated graphics, atmospheric soundscapes, and fast-paced gameplay reminiscent of cult classics like Quake and Doom. However, what sets Dusk apart is its ability to seamlessly blend retro aesthetics with contemporary game design, creating an experience that feels both familiar and fresh.

One of the most striking aspects of Dusk is its level design, which features a diverse array of environments ranging from dilapidated farmhouses to eldritch temples, each meticulously crafted to evoke a sense of dread and unease. As you navigate these haunting locales, you'll encounter a variety of grotesque enemies and deadly traps, keeping you on edge as you fight for survival.

The gameplay in Dusk is fast, fluid, and incredibly satisfying, with tight controls and responsive mechanics that harken back to the glory days of the first-person shooter genre. Whether wielding a shotgun to blast through hordes of demonic foes or executing precision headshots with a sniper rifle, every encounter feels visceral and intense, rewarding skillful play and quick reflexes.

Furthermore, Dusk features a compelling single-player campaign that unfolds across three distinct episodes, each filled with secrets to uncover, challenges to overcome, and bosses to defeat. The campaign's non-linear structure encourages exploration and experimentation, allowing players to tackle levels in their own unique way and uncover hidden secrets and Easter eggs along the way.

In addition to its captivating single-player experience, Dusk also offers robust multiplayer modes, including classic deathmatch and team-based modes, providing endless hours of frenetic online action for competitive players.

However, despite its many strengths, Dusk is not without its flaws. Some players may find the retro-inspired graphics and sound design off-putting, especially those accustomed to modern AAA titles with photorealistic visuals and cinematic storytelling. Additionally, while the game's difficulty curve is generally well-balanced, certain sections can feel punishingly difficult, leading to frustration for some players.

In conclusion, Dusk stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of classic first-person shooters, delivering a thrilling and nostalgic experience that captures the essence of the genre's heyday while offering plenty of modern twists to keep players engaged. Whether you're a veteran shooter fan craving a trip down memory lane or a newcomer looking for a fresh take on the genre, Dusk is sure to delight and terrify in equal measure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007353136', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1708808310}
review:
It's one of the better retro shooters, although I do feel like the game gives you too much ammo, which creates a few issues:
1. It removes the need to strategically swap guns to optimize ammo usage.
2. It removes any sense of reward in finding ammo throughout the level.
3. By the end of Episode 1 I've already gotten bored of the guns as I've been using all of them liberally.

Now I've lost my motivation to finish the other 2 episodes because I've had my fun with the guns and there's no interesting story to keep me going.

author: {'steamid': '76561199095729161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1708513447}
review:
遊戲目的:
類DOOM FPS
三大關, 每一大關10小關
每關在10分鐘內可破
武器總共9把, 也是古早味那幾種
近戰武器, 手槍, 霰彈槍, 雙筒散彈槍 突擊步槍, 獵槍, 十字弓, 榴彈槍, 火箭炮
怪物10多種, 遠程, 進戰, 隱形, 飛行, 非人, 因有盡有

每一關收集三種顏色鑰匙來開門, 很早就會看到無法進入的門
每關都有各種秘密可以搜尋拿到額外補給, 破壞牆壁, 一些小洞可以鑽
地圖指示不明顯, 容易迷路, 沒有地圖可看

有5-6種BOSS, 難度還好, BOSS動作好預測, 抓到攻擊模式很好閃子彈

元素拆解:
類DOOM美術風格
古早味FPS
邪教混沌黑暗劇情
殺敵爽快與迷宮探索各半
難度適中

主要學習點:

FPS基本功
	-走位射擊
	-熟悉各槍枝
	-熟悉敵人行動模式

地圖探索能力
	-路痴容易迷路
	-遊戲內指引不夠

缺點:

對路痴來說找路時間太多會讓手感冷掉
有些路指引太少必須回程或往哪走沒講清楚
變成再浪費時間找路

This game was pretty fun and it gave me a small laugh here and there from some of the spray painted notes spread throughout the game. My favorite probably was the "do a flip" one somewhere in Episode 2. The abilities were good and the time slower being pretty cool in some cases. One thing I did not enjoy was my inability to find the setting to change my mouse sensitivity but that one is one me for not being smrat D:  |  Anyways. good game was worth the money, might need to use the internet to get past some areas in Episode 1 since some codes are needed unless you have the patience to guess random buttons until it opens.

In short, would recommend to try

review: I finally got around to completing DUSK with DUSK HD.  It's incredible and stands apart as one of, if not the best of, the boomer shooter revival.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970909538', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1707697511}
review:
DUSK is awesome. It's a must-play it if you like old-school shooters similar to Quake. They've really perfected the genre.

The 2nd and 3rd episodes are where it has some really inventive level design. The weapons are great and fun to use. It's fast-paced and has lots of secrets to find.

Also the developers recently released a free HD texture pack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039106524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 107, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1712320793}
review:
I played Dusk in the beginning of 2024.

Gameplay is good. Music is fantastic. Enemies are interesting and there are many secrets to find.

A strong 8.5/10. I'm playing this a second time now with the mode that resets your weapons every mission/map. 
Dusk and Cultic have emerged as the best boomer shooters there is at this time. If you play these types of games, you'll love this one. About 7-8 hours to go through and you'll love every moment of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199112516164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 46, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1712081428}
review: If you like old school "Boomer Shooters" then this is the ultimate expression of it. Fast, responsive controls with a useful and interesting arsenal, excellent level design and challenging enemies with a great deal of variety. It feels both very nostalgic and very modern all at once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169057902', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1708271273}
review:
Одна из первых игр, ознаменовавших возвращение бумер-шутеров.
Даже страшно смотреть на дату выхода и осознавать, что прошло уже 5 лет с релиза. Мне, до DUSK игравшему лишь в Duke Nukem 3D, DOOM и Wolfenstein 3D, было крайне приятно месить низкополигональных монстров под зубодробительный саундтрек, стреляя по-македонски. Всё как я люблю. Если вы любите шутеры от первого лица, драйв и хотите олдскула, то DUSK определённо придётся вам по душе. Если бы не он, то, быть может, такой ренессанс жанра случился бы куда позже, если бы случился вовсе.
Проходил на консоли, но потом приобрёл и версию для Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561197996096136', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1695697077}
review:
An absolutely amazing game. This is an amazing game to fill in that "boomer shooter" niche, ramped and tweaked up to take advantage of stronger hardware to allow for some seriously slick movement. 
The visual style captures the game's clear inspiration from founders of the genre like Doom, Quake, and Unreal Tournament. It may or may not be your cup of tea, but personally I think it adds to the overall appeal. There's a certain appeal to watching blocky enemies explode into meaty red giblets after a few well-placed high-caliber shots and explosives. No overhead displays with giant arrows and way-points to tell you where to go; this may be hit-or-miss depending on how lost you can get yourself, but with how absolutely fast and tight the movement is, you probably won't notice too much of it after you get a handle on the controls and won't stay lost for too long as you zip back onto the path. The low system requirements are also incredibly nice to have, so even if you don't have the latest hardware you can still play and sink hours of time into without worrying if your PC is about to combust. Fantastic soundtrack as well if you're a fan of heavier metal; "slower" sections (as much of a misnomer as that may be for this game) filled with lower grungier tunes while arenas and bosses are aptly given faster industrial jams. It all fits right in with the action-horror to kick that adrenaline up as you slaughter your way through bullets, hellfire, and the occasional zombie alligator. 

I may have gotten this game as a gift, but I would absolutely have paid full price for it and still be pleased with the result. [b]Pick this up.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197978917515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3089, 'last_played': 1708292269}

author: {'steamid': '76561199085653777', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1708159286}
review:
[h1] Абсолютно безыдейный клон квейка [/h1]
До выхода DUSK HD эта игра особенно не имела смысла. Оригинальные пушки вообще не имеют импакта. Они ощущаются как игрушки, сделанные пятиклассником на трудах. У игры нет вообще никакой идеи. Все уровни максимально плоские, голые и одинаковые. Тут даже есть специальные ходунцы, созданные на случай, если разраб не сможет сделать нормальный уровень. В тёмных местах здесь как то слишком темно. На многих уровнях присутствует раздражающее перебирание рычагов. Саундтрек гoвнище. Эндрю Хульшульт просто воспользовался тем, что работал над саундтреком к квейк чампионс, поэтому просто залил его сюда. Чаще всего он даже не подходит.

Единственный плюс игры: отсутствие ограничения по скорости. Также хочу отметить, что DUSK HD хорошо прокачивает все оружия, и с ним гораздо приятнее играть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011184099', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1707956611}
review:
Un fps dal gameplay e dai toni molto classici.
Dusk ricorda molto gli fps dei primi anni 90 (Quake 1 in primis), ma ha uno stile tutto suo,molto macabro, che si sposa perfettamente con la sua grafica, che definirei essenziale, quasi minimalista.
Il Gameplay estremamente frenetico, si sviluppa su livelli molto verticali, tendenzialmente labirintici, ma sempre ben realizzati e mai confusionali.
Audio di buona qualità, soprattutto per quanto riguarda le musiche, mentre per la trama nulla di che, classico pretesto anni 90 per fare mattanza di nemici, ma ci stà.
Recentemente è uscito l'aggiornamento (per fortuna opzionale) "Dusk HD" vi consiglio vivamente di NON utilizzarlo, con una grafica leggermente migliorata e modelli di oggetti e nemici più complessi e rifiniti, il gioco perde tantissimo in atmosfera! Dusk è brutto e spigoloso e così dev'essere giocato!  L'HD è da usare al massimo per una seconda run.

Voto: 7.5\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198074564532', 'num_games_owned': 2898, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1708150300}
review:
[i]Dusk[/i] is a great retro FPS!
Plenty of fun guaranteed while taking down enemies with various different weapons to the sound of excellent tracks, true BANGERS!

One aspect that caught my attention is the introduction of character [b]Health[/b] and [b]Morale[/b] throughout the three episodes. [spoiler]However, [b]Morale[/b] only proves to be truly useful in the last episode with the sword. Furthermore, "puzzle elements", so to speak, are only introduced in the third episode.[/spoiler]

I believe that if the game made more use of these mechanics from the beginning, it would be excellent!

author: {'steamid': '76561199039325029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 57, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1712013718}
review:
[h1] [b] DUSK prueba que el gaming moderno es una poronga [/b] [/h1]

doom fue un icono de la epoca, establecio el estandar de los boomer shooters. no sed quien fue el ñoño que bajo la velocidad de movimiento en shooter s modernos, pero arruino el factor mas importante de estos. todos los juegos son automaticamente mejores si son mas acelerados. preferiria jugar doom mil veces antes que counter strike, preferiria jugar a quake antes que gta 5. 

[h2] gameplay [/h2]
como dije antes, la velocidad de movimiento es lo que lo diferencia de otros shooters. este juego va a un paso mas rapido que otros shooters, y te llena de adrenalina. 
a diferencia de doom, este juego no tienen enemigos con hitscan, todos los ataques son justos y telegrafiados, incluso los [i] skinwalkers [/i] (no se como se llama el enemigo, me refiero al [spoiler] ciervo que se hace invisible [/spoiler] ) hacen un ruido especifico cuando te persiguen. esto permite distinguir a que te vas a enfrentar. 
por ultimo, me encanta que por primera vez, el arma melee es una espada medieval, finalmente alguien que no se la chupe a las chinos con la katana esa que no corta nada. me encanto la estetica medieval de los primeros niveles de [u] The Nameless City [/u]

[h2] atmosfera [/h2]
dusk parece una pelicula de terror. te enfrentas a cultistas, mounstros y seres demoniacos. los niveles priorizan crear un buen mundo. el primer capitulo transcurre en maizales, granjas y campos. te enfrentas a espantapajaros poseidos y granjeros locos. hace un buen trabajoo en introducirte a la atmosfera de terror. 
el segundo capitulo transcurre en bases militares, trae a enemigos mas dificiles. los soldados disparan mas seguido y proporcionan un reto mayor. pero como dije antes, no usan hitscan, lo que significa que te da tiempo suficiente para reaccionar. el tercer capitulo culmina la historia enfrentandote a los enemigos mas poderosos de los capitulos anteriores.

[h3] criticismos [/h3]
dusk hereda muchos de los problemas de doom y los boomer shooters en general. el principal es que las armas estan balanceadas por municion. esto significa que el juego se vuelve injusto dependiendo de tu equipamiento. si llegas al siguiente nivel con poca vida y sin balas, va a ser injustamente dificil, y el riveteer elimina facilmente la mitad la vida de un jefe. ultrakill arreglo este problema, la vida se regenera atacando a corta distancia, las armas no requieren municion y ninguna es mas poderosa que la otra, si bien el railgun es muy fuerte, se balancea con coolown, tenes que sobrevir lo suficiente para usarlo. adicionalmente, [spoiler] la pelea final es muy facil. los ataques son muy lentos y faciles de esquivar, y son simples, es simplemente moverte en una direccion [/spoiler]

[h3] conclucion [/h3]
dusk es un juego increible, una perspectiva moderna de los boomer shooters, a pesar de que no evoluciona de los fallos de este genero como ultrakill, sigue siendo una experiencia que vale muchisimo la pena.

review:
quake没玩爽吗
来玩这个
你是old school吗

author: {'steamid': '76561199475696071', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1704353109}
review: Dusk is a game that tries to capture the spirit of the '90s shooters like Doom, Quake, and Half-Life. It has fast-paced action, retro graphics, and a creepy atmosphere. However, it also has a lot of puzzles that slow down the game and frustrate the player. Some of the puzzles are too obscure or tedious, and they often interrupt the flow of the combat. I was expecting a game that would let me blast through hordes of enemies and explore a dark and twisted world, but instead I found myself stuck in rooms with switches, keys, and hidden passages. Dusk is a game that has a lot of potential, but it is ruined by its excessive reliance on puzzles. It is a game that I wanted to love, but I ended up feeling disappointed and bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561199260528843', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1708147968}
review:
This game is truly amazing! It seamlessly combines the fast-paced action of classic boomer shooters like Doom with spine-chilling horror elements, creating an unparalleled gaming experience. It's nothing short of awesome! The level designs are impeccable, filled with intricate puzzles that keep you engaged at every turn. And let's talk about the music – it's absolutely banging! The soundtrack sets the perfect tone for each adrenaline-pumping encounter.

Visually, the game is a masterpiece. The designs are incredibly cool, from the terrifying monsters to the haunting environments. And the bosses? They're simply unspeakably awesome. Each one more challenging and epic than the last, they're a true testament to the game's impeccable design.

But what really sets this game apart is its story. It's rich, immersive, and utterly captivating. As you delve deeper into the game, you'll uncover layers of mystery and intrigue that will keep you hooked until the very end.

If you've ever stepped at Dooms gate, and if you've ever Quaked before... you cannot pass this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350816720', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1707151394}
review: Very similar to Chicago.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996077753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1707171381}
review:
Grandísimo boomer shooter inspirado en Quake y Doom en el que tenemos que adentrarnos en el infierno mismo para matar a unos cultistas y sus monstruos. 

Lo único malo que le veo es que no tiene puntos de control (checkpoints), así que como te maten vas a tener que hacer todo de nuevo. En la mayoría de niveles no es problema porque son bastante cortitos, pero en algunos como te maten y tengas que hacer todo de nuevo vas a cabrearte mucho.

Pero en general, es un gran juego. Ah, y tiene una versión HD y un DLC con todas las versiones anteriores y las que no salieron, completamente gratis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214621288', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1707136263}
review: Dusk is a game that takes all the right lessons from horror-esque games like it, like Blood or Doom. Through and through it was a fantastic experience that constantly surprised me with how it presented itself. No hitscans exist, easter eggs are wildly fun, and playing on Cero Miedo truly got my adrenaline rushing, even when I started dying multiple times by the final levels. The horror part of it really got to me as well, trying to make me feel scared and brave at the same time like I'm an idiot who isn't supposed to rush in yet I do anyways. This is undeniably a must play, especially for massive boomer shooter fans.

review:
I just chugged a Jack Daniel's and everything is starting to look like my nag wife!

Dusk is a fantastic shooter and horror game. It has a rich atmosphere, really fun and creative level designs, pulpy easter eggs and references, with super satisfying and silky movement and guns. Also lots of blood and eldritch horrors. Besides a few puzzles that can burn in hell and sometimes buffering a little, it's an easy recommend.

review: 精心设计的地图，丰富多样的武器，特色鲜明的怪物，爽快劲爆的音乐，最重要的，一流的射击手感，好玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004072139', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1785, 'last_played': 1706810575}
review:
Данную игру я могу назвать редким представителем жанра хоррор-шутеров, которые реально пугают вплоть до откладывания кирпичей и которых можно по пальцам одной руки пересчитать: Квейк, Дум 3, Квейк 4, ФЕАР и вот Даск. Уже одно это делает данную игру уникальной.
В остальном же, это шутер, который вобрал в себя, приумножил и адаптировал под современные стандарты все лучшее, что было в первых шутерах 90-х годов прошлого века. Графика - нечто среднее между первыми двумя Думами и первым Квейком, атмосфера и ощущение оружия, тоже будто из Квейка. 
В чем данная игра ощутимо превосходит старые, так это в дизайне уровней. Старые игры сегодня ощущаются визуально очень однообразными, все уровни похожи друг на друга, разница лишь в конфигурации комнат. Здесь же, каждый уровень, это новая локация не похожая, ну или почти не похожая на все, что было до этого. Вообще, игра визуально очень красивая. Все эти темные леса, мрачные подземелья, кроваво-красные небеса, необычные для нашего - реального мира конструкции и сооружения - всё очень красиво сделано. Может немного не дотягивает до Amid Evil'а, но превосходит большую часть, если не все, остальные игры жанра. Плюс великолепное музыкальное сопровождение, очень атмосферное, каждый трек идеально подчеркивает происходящее на экране. Треки разнообразные - есть медленные, симфонические, атмосферные, а есть и боевые, скоростные, металические, в общем на любой вкус, подходят не только для этой игры, но и для отдельного прослушивания.
По итогу, великолепная игра во всех отношениях и возможно лучший Бумер-Шутер 21 века. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197965285661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1706707904}
review:
Oh Boy. 

Take yourself back to the year 1998 and you walk yourself into a Gateway Home Personal Computer Store. 

It's layed out sort of like a beta version of an Apple store except there is alot of Cow fur print designs all over the walls and they have a few PCs in the center of the store to highlight their immense gaming power.

You walk over to one of the PC's on display for someone to try and sure enough they are running an FPS game that uses the first version of the Quake engine to show off the mighty power of the Radeon 9800 Pro/

This game is what you are playing in that store that convinces you that you HAVE to buy a Gateway PC or you will never stop until you get one.

Welcome to DUSK.

review:
Al netto di qualche livello un po' meno azzeccato di altri a livello di design, si tratta di uno dei boomer shooter migliori usciti finora, se non il migliore, e sicuramente quello che consiglierei per primo a chi volesse approcciarsi al genere. Una pletora di opzioni permettono poi sicuramente di adattare l'esperienza davvero a tutti, da chi vuole qualcosa di VERAMENTE retro a chi cerca invece il feel ma non la legnosità di quei proto-FPS.
La colonna sonora spacca qualsiasi cosa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041702486', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1698480500}
review: I was never much of a "boomer shooter" / movement shooter type of guy. I started with Doom 2016, then played Eternal, and then ultrakill. Ultrakill blew my socks off so hard that I felt I had to try some of the other highly regarded ones. I played Amid Evil first, and then Dusk. Amid Evil was ok, I enjoyed parts of it, but it didnt really stick out to me too much. Dusk, on the other hand, was worse. Other than the vague horror elements this game feels very bland to me. It plays well, and I did have fun during it, but it just doesnt do much for me. Back to waiting for ultrakill updates i suppose :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198113501442', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1703288730}
review:
[h1] UM FPS EM EXCELÊNCIA [/h1]
Este jogo é extremamente incrível,  ação pura do começo ao fim

Você já é jogado na ação, sem muitas explicações, e daí pra frente as coisas só ficam mais loucas

A ambientação macabra junto com os gráficos lowpoli e uma trilha sonora super assertiva criam todo um clima super imersivo, onde você sente sempre que tem algo errado, que tem uma ameaça logo ali, e quando chega a hora de enfrentar as ameaças…

No combate o jogo te faz se sentir foda. A alta mobilidade, as explosões das armas e a trilha sonora bem pesada te fazem entrar num frenesi explodindo tudo. Altas doses de adrenalina. 

O ultimo capitulo é o ponto mais alto do jogo, fechando com chave de ouro, com varias experimentações de level design e visuais

Este jogo acabou se tornando um most-play do genêro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981737281', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1706387806}
review:
Итак, DUSK был пройден на самом последнем уровне сложности, где тебя ваншотают. Не знаю зачем я это сделал, ведь ачивки не было такой, но даже при таком раскладе была лишь пара моментов, где приходилось по несколько десятков раз умирать. Но очень уж хотелось посмотреть на игру, которая, вроде как, возродила в своё время интерес к бумер шутерам. 

Игра разбита на 3 главы и у каждой своё настроение. Шикарный саунд дизайн, разнообразная музыка. Целый арсенал оружия и ты используешь почти каждое из них. Постоянная смена темпа: то ты на арене, то на больших полянах, то в узких катакомбах. 3 глава с её пространственными приколами стоит отдельного упоминания. 

Много видов противников и лишь культистов сделали в варианте "он пожирнее и красненький", остальные мобы все уникальные. 

Однозначно рекомендую к ознакомлению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983675369', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1710845697}
review: ZUSK

author: {'steamid': '76561198002067985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1707624362}
review:
An excellent baby's first boomer shooter that brought me back to watching my dad play DOOM and Quake as a kid. DUSK is gracefully not even a little bit self-conscious about its premise, instead putting a sincere effort into emulating the game design, graphics, and cheesy Slipknotcore edgelord atmosphere of 90s shooters. I'm so happy it's not a spoof.

I do, however, wish there was more thought put into some of the enemy designs. I certainly don't mind shooting down mobs in white hoods in a video game, but I can't help but wonder what a bunch of presumably racist cultists are doing worshiping an Eldritch horror? Even for a camp throwback shooter game, that doesn't really speak to the history of either racism or Lovecraftian horror. I'm not sure what a creature from Native American folklore is doing in this game, either. Like, just make original designs if all you need is mobs to shoot in your boomer shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053624818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1706155471}
review:
One of the best FPS games made in the last fifteen years along side Doom 2016 and Titanfall 2. Everything feels smooth and the levels generally are incredibly well-designed and atmospheric. There's an art to making organic FPS levels, and the devs mostly nailed it here.

My only serious complaint is that the last four or five missions are kind of lame and don't measure up to rest of the game's creative map-design and boss encounters, culminating with: a gimmicky platforming mission, a generic arena fight against endless waves, followed by a circle strafe competition with a mini-boss, and then a completely forgettable final boss.

Also, there is a free added HD-textures mod offered by the devs, which is greatly appreciated. It's nice to see a game company that actually cares about their product and users.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118254878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 45, 'playtime_at_review': 4753, 'last_played': 1711683103}
review: One of best first person shooters I've played in a while. The gun play feels absolutely amazing and no guns get outclassed by another (except maybe the pistols). The game has amazing environmental story telling through the layouts of the maps and the look of said maps as well. The game also brings a lot of replay value to the table such as the arena mode where you kill endless hoards of enemies, the countless amount of secrets there are to discover, and even the workshop bringing in custom, user-made levels for you to play. All in all, Dusk is a fantastic game that shines a light to the shooters of the old days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028993256', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1709172508}
review:
What a great boomershooter! I really got into boomershooters in the last couple years and I played A LOT of them. Serious sam, doom, ion fury, duke nukem, cultic, wraith of eon and many more. So far I found this little gem here to be my favorite. 

The gunplay is fast and destructive if using the right weapons against a certain enemy type. The graphics are atmospheric and creepy. The levels are very well designed with not too much looking where to go. Some maps were a little too confusing. The enemy types look cool, there could be a little more though. Story? Don´t need it. The movement takes a little time getting used to, because you are faster than in most other games.

If you like little Horror, Boomer shooters and fast-paced, but also strategic gunplay, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087892334', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1705818926}
review:
It's alright. It does all the classic shooter tropes well, and the art & music make a wonderfully bleak atmosphere. I just...really don't like the level design. Besides the final act, some of the levels have a "hub and spoke" layout with locked doors at the end of half the paths and keys (or buttons) at the end of the other paths. It results in a ton of backtracking through areas with no enemies, something that really kills the otherwise fast pace of the game. It's particularly annoying on your first playthrough as you rarely know what path holds the correct key to progress.

The last chapter of the game has much more intuitive level layouts and some really creative arenas to play around in; they really make up for the weaker levels of the campaign. If the game looks interesting to you, certainly try it, but don't be afraid to look up a guide if you end up going in circles early on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038713122', 'num_games_owned': 1082, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1703379925}
review:
A strong old-school FPS with a lot of interesting level design and setpieces. Really captures the Quake feeling, while still holding up on its own. 

One thing I like with the level design is that its weapon placement allows for an alternate game mode called intruder mode. Intruder mode removes all your weapons on a per-level basis, making you scrounge for guns and ammo around the map. The dual pistols you'd usually neglect using after level three or something end up being awesome when it's all you have, or when you gotta save the seven shotgun shells you scavenged to off the big monsters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971793035', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1705750487}
review:
OK boomer shooter. You need to have OK reflexes in some places to defeat bigger enemy hordes, but no hard jumping sections nor quick time sections.

[b]Plusses:[/b]  
+ Run well on older machines  
+ Fast level loading times  
+ There are couple of very good levels  
+ HD texture/model DLC is free  

[b]Minuses:[/b]  
- Weapon balance is off (some weapons are way better than others)  
- No weapon upgrades nor playstyle customizations  
- Most enemies are just pure cannon fodder   
- Very uneven level design (some are really bad)  
- Save/load menu could use some redesign  
- Some secrets are too easy to find  
- Item carrying feels very gimmicky  

[b]Ugly:[/b]
* Visible moire in some HD textures  
* Too many minor bugs  
* You cannot load vanilla saves in HD version

author: {'steamid': '76561198364424876', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1712438680}
review: Супер ультра кайфовий шутер для справжніх поціновувачів бумерських стрілянок. Дуже сподобалися усі місцеві чудики: усе починалося дядьками з бензопилами й мішками на головах, а закінчилося чудернацькою кулею, яка левітує і кидається черепами. Останні боси теж прикольні. Перший - це ніби іншого гравця до мене запустили(я легко розмотав того нубіка), а другий - тупо нереальна краказябра. Мені сподобалися. Набір зброї тут, наче й звичайна, як для такого роду пострілушек, але уся вона корисна й добре вписується в ігролад, тож дорікати точно немає сенсу. Я радий, що відкопав цю перлину в недрях стіму й провів тут багато годин. Хоча, мабуть, доведеться провести ще плюс-мінус стільки ж, щоб усі ачівочки дістати.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015188445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1706084618}

author: {'steamid': '76561198843831064', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1705624509}
review:
[h1] *ruidos de sectario* [/h1]

Dusk es un juego bastante sencillo pero adictivo y rejugable, pero sobre todo, una estética más que curiosa.

Dusk tiene la estética de un juego clásico de PSX pero con la diferencia que su ambientación tétrica la de una vuelta de rosca más curiosa. A su vez, estamos en frente de un shooter a la vieja escuela, es decir, contamos con una selección de armas variadas y vida, el resto es matar y saltar por todos lados.

Se me hizo un juego sencillo, pero con mucho potencial a ser rejugado, principalmente porque cuenta con marcadores y en sí el juego te incita a hacer el mayor caos en el menor tiempo posible. El movimiento del personaje es muy fluido y bastante fácil de hacerse con los controles; lo único negativo puede ser el primer contacto que puede ser brusco.

Dusk es un juego curioso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113906364', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1707252248}
review:
Probably the best feeling and for me the most enjoyable boomer-shooter I've played so far.
Great levels full of interesting ideas and secrets. They flow very naturally and I never found myself lost. No level felt as though it dragged on for too long. Every level took me around 8-12 minutes each.
The weapons felt great. Each of them look, feel and sound very powerful. The shotguns were especially fun to use.
In terms of graphics I think the HD version was far superior but I might be biased because that's the first version I tried.
The only negatives I can think of are that most boss fights were just running around in a circle and the semi-final level was kinda boring.
All in all I went in expecting a solid 7-8 out of 10 experience but got at least a 9.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972330622', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1660965732}
review:
An amazing game! The developers did wonders capture the feeling of the old FPS genre games like Doom and Quake.

The sound design is great and music is very fitting for the fast paced action. Weapon design is interesting, the standard things you would expect, but there were some surprising ones that I did not anticipate.

Overall it's a intense enough game to keep you focused in, but not too much that you can relax and shut your mind off to play.

I highly recommend this if you enjoy old style FPS and/or low polycount pixel graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978712585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1704842069}
review:
Как нормальный человек я должен был начать своё знакомство с данным издателем с самой популярной игрой – ULTRAKILL, но выбирая игру по отзывам и скриншотам, я выбрал наименее популярную - AMID EVIL. Выбор был сделан главным образом из-за Ray Tracing. Я уже писал по поводу игры AMID EVIL, поэтому отмечу, что я постоянно сравнивал эти две игры. Да, я знаю, что их делали разные разработчики, но, тем не менее, мне было интересно сравнить эти две игры. Если честно, DUSK больше походит на Blood: Fresh Supply, нежели на AMID EVIL. Но короче, DUSK из той же серии что и AMID EVIL, но проигрывает ей практически во всём, за исключением обычных монстров и, возможно, музыки.

Графика. Тут очевидно, что AMID EVIL, благодаря Ray Tracing, обходит DUSK довольно существенно. Я не являюсь любителей пиксельной графики, поэтому я был несказанно рад, что недавно было выпущено бесплатное дополнение под названием DUSK HD, суть которого понятна из названия. В целом, графика приятная. Она в разы лучше, чем в Blood: Fresh Supply, но Blood, это уже немного другой вариант этого жанра. Можно было бы сделать более качественную картину в DUSK? Думаю да, но тогда потребовался бы целый штат людей. А у нас тут простенький боевичок созданный под стилистику игр эпохи Quake. Поэтому в контексте заданных рамок, графическая составляющая игры выполнена в рамках стандартных требований. В игре появляются уникальные события, которые неплохо демонстрируют существующие графическим возможности игры, как например, момент, когда огромный смерч сносит церковь, в которой мы только что были или когда открывается большой купол и оказывается что мы всё это время бегали в каком-то гигантском ангаре. Я хочу сказать, что разработчик смог удивить и выжать максимум из того что у него имелось в графическом плане. Это приятно, ибо в игре присутствует множество моментов, которые хорошо разбавляют многочисленные коридоры и туннели, набитые множеством врагов. Ещё один пример нестандартного (креативного) подхода разработчика, который никак не связан с графической составляющей игры, это когда игрок впервые встречается с невидимыми врагами (в которых нужно попасть, чтобы они стали видимыми). 

Оружие. Набор доступного оружия в игре одновременно стандартен – пистолеты, дробовик, автомат, ракетница, арбалет – но и не обычен. К примеру, арбалет  имеет свойство пробивать врагов насквозь, благодаря чему можно собрать целый шампур из врагов. Гранатомёт выстреливает светящимися круглыми шариками-гранатами, которые взрываются лишь в случаи, если прямо попадают по врагу, в ином случаи продолжают лежать, но при этом их можно взорвать, используя альтернативную атаку. Таким образом, можно накидать множество таких гранат и взорвать их разом в определённый момент. На этом заканчивается уникальное оружие. Но в принципе, неужели ради уникальной пушки люди создают такие игры и играют в такие игры? Не думаю. Разумеется, приятно увидеть уникальное или необычное оружие, но это не является критически значимым фактором успеха игры. Поэтому можно сказать, что оружие здесь примерно стандартное. В любом случаи, что самое главное, стрелять из него приятно.

Локации. Вот тут игра сильно проигрывает AMID EVIL, которая меня зачаровывала именно своими нереально сложноустроенными локациями, которые раскрывались изнутри подобно розе. В этой игре локации обычны и чаще всего представляют из себя либо туннели, либо относительно широкие пространства. Сами локации сделаны не плохо и опять же чем-то отдалённо напоминали локации из Blood: Fresh Supply, хотя в DUSK они проработаны намного лучше. Приятно, что со многими объектами можно взаимодействовать, как например, поднять кусок пенящегося (!) мыла или включить душ, спустить воду в унитазе или разжечь костер, с помощью которого можно поджечь стоящий рядом стул или деревянную коробку. Да, всё это носит исключительно декоративные функции, но мне было приятно, что разработчик уделил внимание даже таким мелочам. Многие вещи в игре, прям как в Half-Life, можно брать в руки, перемещать и бросать. Многие предметы напомнили мне именно Half-Life (при этом подчеркну, что игра в целом далека от какого-либо элемента классической Half-Life). Как я отметил касаемо графической составляющей, разработчик старается отвлекать игрока от бесконечной беготни с отстрелом врагов. В игре достаточно моментов, когда хочется остановиться и полюбоваться открывшемуся пейзажу. Разумеется, отдельно отмечу уровни с перевёрнутой локацией. Автор решил в лучшем жанре психологического хоррора поиграть с восприятием игрока и у него получилось. Я реально передвигался медленно в такой локации, которая отличается только тем, что она была перевёрнута. Ну, какая разница как выглядит пол, если это лишь компьютерная игра? Но я реально двигался медленно из-за этого. Игра разработчика с сознанием игрока, это, пожалуй, лучшее определение всей игры, если мы оставим за скобками боевую составляющую.

Монстры. В принципе, их тут не так много как AMID EVIL, но как я писал в отзыве на AMID EVIL, в этой игре все враги даны в виде еле заметных форм, очертаний, ибо в AMID EVIL не имеет особого значения, кто является врагом. В этой же игре это важно и мы отчётливо может отличить служителя культа от спецназовца и тем более, от уникального врага – смеси собаки и тарана (пожалуй, один из лучших врагов какой я видел в таком типе игр). Так вот, в AMID EVIL было не важно, кто перед нами, ибо мы видели лишь едва заметные и значимые образы, чего было вполне достаточно. Но в этой игре значимым было именно кто перед нами, т.е. какие враги перед нами. Выполнены они неплохо и все различаются друг от друга, как в визуальном плане, так и в плане поведения. В прицепе, с монстрами ситуация обстоит ровно так же как с оружие, т.е. есть пару уникальных экземпляров, но в целом всё по стандарту. Это не может являться минусом – просто так выглядит и задумана игра (такова концепция). Но реализовано это хорошо.

Ну и заканчивая, хочется спросить: а вообще, интересно играть в такой древних артефакт, если мы имеем боевики с супер-пупер графикой типа Doom Eternal, Crysis 1-3 и так далее? А действительно, почему игра с графикой начала 2000-х или что-то типа этого, привлекает людей, у которых видеокарты 3000 или даже 4000 серии от Nvidia? Ну, какой смысл вообще в компьютерной развитии, если людям хватает графики, которую спокойно тянула моя  Sapphire HD 7700 с одним гигом, которую я в позапрошлом году поменял на 3060, но которая тянула почти все актуальные игры, включая Doom 2016 и Skyrim? А я не знаю. Одно из предположений, почему такие игры пользуются популярностью, состоит в том, что игры типа AMID EVIL и DUSK, они просты, ибо тут нет сюжета (сложного), диалогов и пр. Тут просто тупо бежишь и убиваешь, всё что попадается, ведь даже великий и ужасный Serious Sam дрогнул и добавил сюжет, диалоги и пр. (правда, это появилось уже во второй части Serious Sam). А может, эпичная графика просто…ослепляет игрока, превращая игру в цветистую кашу? Поэтому игрок подобен гражданину начала XX века, который устал от всех этих рембрандтов и веласкесов и захотел простоты – супрематизма, чистых линий. Ведь то же самое случилось и в архитектуре, не так ли? Так что такие игры и дальше будут пользоваться спросом, ибо дело не в графике (хотя и в ней тоже).

author: {'steamid': '76561198042354809', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1705085173}
review:
What an amazing game!

Did not expect to enjoy it as much as I did! The movement is fantastic, the levels are not too short but not too long either, great weapon variety, beautiful sound design & amazing music, a great atmosphere, and a lot of different settings. 

As someone who absolutely hates horror, there were only a few places in the entire game where I felt a little bit on the edge, so if you're someone like me, don't let this tag be a discouragement from experiencing this game.

A no-brainer recommendation to people who either enjoy boomer shooters or just want to have a really good FPS experience.

review: De los mejores shooter de este estilo que puedes encontrar, replica perfectamente la fluidez y adictividad del gunplay de Doom, Quake, etc. pero con una identidad propia, sobre todo en diseño de niveles y enemigos, además de varias ideas implementadas en el gameplay como consecuencia de ser un juego mucho más moderno y con muchos mas ejemplos de los que tomar inspiración que los anteriormente mencionados.

review:

---{ Price }---

☐ Not recommended
☐ You could also just burn your money

One of the best retro shooters of recent years, maybe the best. Imagine to yourself, what if ID Software stopped jerking us around about a new Quake and just gave us 3 new retro Quake campaigns?

There's so many ideas crammed into one game, it's shocking how much there is here. Gameplay is tight, fast, every enemy is compelling and fun to fight. Levels are ridiculously diverse. HD version is straight-up a free remaster, but I honestly prefer the VoodooFX-style chunky look.

Pros:
- Fast, fluid gameplay with some S tier level design, variety, and set pieces
- Great enemies to fight, constantly throws new stuff at you.
- Amazing soundtrack
- Basically the spiritual successor to Quake 1

Cons:
- Some later chapters feel rushed.
- Narrative is threadbare but there's a lot of environmental storytelling.
