author: {'steamid': '76561198795903831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1705169050}
review:
What hasn't been said about Dusk at this point? If you are on the fence then jump right off onto the "BUY DUSK NOW" side. This game entirely makes the case for legacy FPS aesthetics and design, not simply as an homage to the classics but a starting point for building something new upon those hallowed foundations.

If you're one of the lucky ones who has no prior knowledge and have just stumbled onto this title then keep that slate blank, jump in and enjoy yourself.

Dusk is an often astonishing achievement that is above all a total blast to play through and chilling to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071693252', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1705080793}
review:
I bought this game years ago but got distracted by the barrage of various other game releases and regrettably didn't end up finally playing DUSK until recently. Turns out, this game is utterly brilliant and not playing it back then was a huge mistake. This game is phenomenal and has been a massive breath of fresh air. 

Bunny-hopping around exceptionally designed levels while cycling between the high quality arsenal of weapons will go down as one of my favorite gaming experiences in recent memory. I haven't had an fps experience that compares to this game since Doom Eternal, and wholeheartedly recommend it to absolutely everyone that's a fan of fps games in general.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198257047281', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1706234255}
review:
Orgasmos demoníacos,
cosas macabras rondan por mi mente,
pensamientos retorcidos,
dos cañones,
dos cartuchos,
y el gatillo.

Sangre y mas sangre,
saciando mi locura,
viendo a mis enemigos
caer como la noche oscura.

Me encanta verlos llorar,
me encanta verlos suplicar,
pedir piedad,
pero los sueños en mi mente,
dicen que te van a matar.

Derramare mas sangre por todos,
pero por ellos no,
sino por nosotros.
Creare terror,

author: {'steamid': '76561198112586418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1705291103}
review: DUSK combines the classic gameplay loop of the original DOOM with the atmosphere of Resident Evil 4 to great effect. There are lots of fun weapons, unique enemies and creative levels that made this game super enjoyable to play. Although it can get mildly repetitive at times due to the nature of the genre, DUSK still has enough variety in its levels and boss battles to keep me engaged. It can get quite challenging too, especially on harder difficulties, which made clearing levels that much more satisfying. I can highly recommend DUSK if you're a fan of classic boomer shooters, or if you want a fun shooter experience with a spooky horror setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972974253', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1705531866}
review:
Took me a while to get into but it’s a good game.

Personally I feel this is the weakest of the new blood interactive wave of boomer shooters but it’s by far the most true to the genre.

I didn’t like it at first and not until my third attempt at playing did it finally click for me.

Finding secrets is a big part of the game that I didn’t realize at first. I felt under powered and out gunned until I started looking for all the secrets that held weapons cache or power ups.

It’s also cool that the developers released a FREE HD pack, although personal I prefer the aesthetic of the original. One note, to get the HD pack running on steam deck you need to switch to a proton version instead of the Linux version

author: {'steamid': '76561198284001402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1704789429}
review:
Solid fast paced boomer-shooter with good level design!


[b]GOOD[/b]
- Good level design! It has enough complexity to make it interesting, without making it too much of a maze.
- Music is pretty good!
- Weapons are decent. You can have dual pistols and dual shotguns. I was hoping for dual double-barreled shotguns, but that was a bit too optimistic.
- Has some unusual settings like; customize color palette and crosshair, weapon size and pixelization (how retro you want the graphics).
- Devs recently updated the game with HD graphics and I really like it! Graphics are significantly improved! (you can still choose to play the original version when launching the game).
- Mod support!

[b]NEUTRAL[/b]
- No weapon reloading. Generally I think this is a negative, but it kinda goes hand-in-hand with the fast paced action in Dusk.
- No map view. Didn't bother me too much, but it would have been nice.

[b]BAD[/b]
- No Auto-Saving. Don't forget to save and save often!!
- Sound effects are mediocre, especially the weapon sounds.
- Enemy variation could have been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064562413', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1709743702}
review:
The more I play this game the more I like it. It starts off corny, but if you give it a chance DUSK reveals itself as a greatly enjoyable shooter with tons of love put into even the smallest details. 
The game starts off a bit too easy, but settles at a good difficulty level around the second episode, which it maintains well, with some genuinely quite tough fights and importance put on prioritising certain enemies. The weapon selection is quite good as well, with the crossbow being one of the most creative and fun meta weapons I've seen in any game with a ton of applications if you know the game well

author: {'steamid': '76561199371725912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1704754241}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329494445', 'num_games_owned': 1653, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1705820806}
review:
A very well-done retro-styled FPS. Though Dusk might not be the first modern FPS to take on this retro design/aesthetic, it's widely considered to be the game that jumpstarted this recent wave of so-called "Boomer Shooters" in the indie game scene.

Dusk definitely feels very similar to Quake 1, with maybe a little bit of Monolith's Blood sprinkled in because of its creepy atmosphere. It has some interesting, trippy moments with its level design, especially during a particular segment in Episode 3.

Gunplay is fast, frenetic, and satisfying, and it is entirely possible to do jumpflips while shooting at enemies. For those who are interested in getting into this recent wave of 2010's/20's retro shooters, Dusk is a really good one to start with.

EDIT: I've since played through all the episodes again to get most of the remaining achievements. Went with the recent Dusk HD pack, and the textures and enemy/weapon models have had a nice touch-up. Hope to see a Dusk 2 in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561199028233200', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1706494392}
review:
Es una porquería por 10 DOLARES sin historia, sin tutorial, ni sabes que es tu personaje, hombre o maquina. Lo único bueno que le vi fue que tenia dos dlc gratis y por suerte, porque imagina, pagar para mejorar lo que es imposible de mejorar. Aparte es super difícil, si van a hacer una porquería por lo menos apiadense del jugador poniendo un checkpoint, aunque sea a la mitad del nivel porque no es lindo estar por terminar un nivel y que te mate una jodida rata.
Si vas a comprar esta aberración piénsalo dos veces por favor, y si lo calificaste bien te tengo una pregunta ¡¿QUE DEMONIOS LE VISTE DE BUENO A ESTA BASURA?!.
Me siento totalmente estafado

If you like doom play this game. It will be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074876127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1704496223}
review:
After years of knowing it by reputation, I'm happy to say that it lives up to the legend.

Much like Ultrakill (another New Blood FPS) it positions itself as a successor to Quake in combat, aesthetics and themes: fast combat, increasingly ruthless levels, opportunities for style, and a mashup of sci-fi with dark fantasy and cosmic horror. However, whereas Ultrakill prioritizes maximizing style (paired with a more melancholic story about existentialism and mortality), Dusk favors heavy exploration (combined with a more outright horrific and oppressive narrative).

In the end, if you love first person shooters and horror, this is a must-play. Also I recommend the HD graphics. I know a lot of people love the original graphics, but I never could get used to them, which is why it took me this long to play it myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198999106944', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1675041044}

review:
An excellent boomer shooter with very satisfying game play, a plethora of interesting stages to traverse, many optional secrets and challenges, and plenty of goofs. A very short, sweet, and simple experience.

Update: After getting all of the achievements, I can say that they were a blast to get and really made me realize just how well designed everything in Dusk is. Genuinely, it is one of the most refined and balanced games I have ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838777382', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1706413367}
review:
Great fast and fun game i played so far 
The game encourage you to bhop and you master it in not time

Enemies wise are unique in designs and combat aspect 

The guns however isnt that much the only new unfamiliar weapons is sickles and crossbow and the sword , it wont be matter to you if you not fan of arena shooter/boomer shooter

The visual is impressive dont let the outside look of the game fools you its well designed in my book and there is HD version of dusk for better visual if you are interested 

The multiplayer is extremely fun when there is enough players but the online aspect of it kinda sleepy 

Overall the game is recommended and you wont regret to have it 
Like what MandaloreGaming said:
"its feel like quake ll we never got".

author: {'steamid': '76561198006147020', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1704668540}
review:
Platform: SteamDeck (Verified) SteamDock
XBox controller

I'd been compiling a shortlist for my 2024 backlog and looking for a good game to play for the New Year. Lo and behold, there was Dusk.

Now I've tried playing a couple of times docked on my SteamDeck with a couple of controllers, but they didn't seem to work. So with some finagling (by loading the official controller settings and restarting my Deck) I was up and running. And I have to say, I'm hooked...hooked by the sick weapon play, level design, art and music. This is good old fashioned 90's FPS, and it's glorious.

It really brings me back to my FPS days playing Duke Nukem and Half-Life mostly, with some System Shock 2, BioShock, and Deus Ex. Over the years, though, especially with the whole wave of indie, my tastes changed and I didn't really play much more recent FPS or shooters, especially because of the demand for better hardware and what seemed to me AAA sameyness. Ironically, it took New Blood, this indie developer to bring me back.

For anyone who's afraid that it might be too derivative, don't worry. The devs have put their own spin on things. It might play like a classic, but they've really ironed out the details and controls, with plenty of customizations possible, including difficulty. There's a move that's a spin on the Half-Life 1 jump+crouch mechanic, albeit I haven't played with it much yet. Still, there's lots of potential.

Theme is definitely important, so it's worth mentioning that this is a horror game through and through. But even though I played with headphones on my TV, it's not too scary. It's more atmospheric. And maybe it's the retro graphics and vibe of the game, but it feels chill to play. There's a manageable amount of visual noise with an easy to digest interface and satisfying game feel both in the moment-to-moment gunfights and the superb level design.

So check Dusk out if you're looking for a class act in retro FPS gunplay goodness that manages to pay homage to the games that inspire Dusk, while also adding their own game as an example in its own right of what more can still be done with this genre.
 
Plus, the soundtrack totally kicks ass!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052422878', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1704295985}
review:
[h1] Грешник, не признавший культ игры [/h1]

Один из первых качественных ретро-шутеров, который вдобавок получил обновление для современных комплюктеров. 
Стильная графика, отличная оптимизация, простой и понятный ганплей. Однако играть, лично мне, достаточно быстро стало скучно. Не в плане сложности, ее то конечно можно накрутить, а в плане геймплея. 

На мой взгляд, здесь средненький левел-дизайн, неудобный, к тому же игра никак не поощряет исследование уровней, те же секретки не дают ничего толкового, кроме обычных ресурсов.

Стилистика по началу прикольная, но достаточно быстро уходит в какое-то своеобразное нечто, почему-то напоминающее первую халфу после уровней в лаборатории. 

Я понимаю, что эта игра имеет культовый статус, так как стала одним из первых качественных представителей бумер-шутеров и я прекрасно понимаю почему. Но, на мой взгляд, сейчас и так хватает игр в этом жанре и на их фоне, Dusk будто тускнеет, а все особенности и фишки кажутся привычными и обыденными. Тот же HROT, на мой вкус, в разы симпатичнее и играется приятнее.

И в этот раз, к моему сожалению, культовость и лаконичность геймплея не позволили мне получать удовольствие от игры, зато очень быстро появилось ощущение скуки и интерес проходить дальше совсем пропал. Это клевая игра, качественная, но я всё равно скажу ей нет и поднять палец вверх мне не кажется ошибкой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002557842', 'num_games_owned': 1103, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1704283585}
review: Retro shooter que aunque la base es Doomesca, hay influencias del FPS pre dosmilero como Half Life, Goldeneye, etc. Juego que va un pasito más allá del mero homenaje y le intenta meter cosas de cosecha propia. Fantástica ambientación y variedad de niveles, le falla algo el gunplay: poca variedad de armas, muy lentas y falta de contundencia. El control y la cámara tampoco afinan mucho cuando el juego se pone creativo. Aun así, la gente de New Blood entiende que hace grande los boomers shooters y Dusk HD es muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199880794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1708092160}
review:
DUSK is very simple. Probably, that's one of the strongest sides of this game, considering there's nothing to stop you from just jumping in and starting a massacre. The gamefeel is one of those things you can't relay in a review, especially in the text form, but I think it's safe to say that most people (myself included) find the controls satisfying.

Another thing that draws in is the setting and directional choises. The game doesn't contain any cutscenes, it never asks you to take your fingers off keys. Everything that is shown you have to see for yourself. While the game looks downright ugly, it really captivates your attention with the ideas of levels themselves. Something that is very much enhanced by soundtrack. Sometimes DUSK feels like a game a kid with lots of imagination would make if they were given a sizable budget. And I don't mean it in a bad way; on a contrary, it feels like someone's dream come true.

However it does show that simplicity also one of the main downsides of DUSK. The game is so simple, you could call it primitive. Player has very standard set of guns and even more standard set of enemies that not vary throughout the whole game. Excluding only a couple of examples, most enemies are just the same concept put in different skins. They walk and shoot. Sometimes they shoot homing projectiles. Sometimes they shoot grenades. Maybe sometimes they fly. But they never show some complex behaviour. It becomes painfully obvious when you meet first few bosses - they're just the same enemy but with a huge healthbar on top. And if you might think that this would change later in game, I have sad news for you. Really, nothing changes in the way you play throughout DUSK. You don't learn any skills, none of the enemies really test them or push you to your limits. Because every enemy acts the same, you can't expect change in player's behaviour. To really understand why it's true just jump into endless mode for a couple of days, and see how long it takes before you stop having fun. DUSK is so simple, the gameplay feels solid and familiar. Something you already accustomed to and want more of. But if it weren't for presentational choices in the campain, this game easily might've been forgotten because of how shallow game design is.

While I enjoyed my time playing, I just can't be sure that it were enemies or arenas since first ones are uninspiring and second ones mostly serve to set the scene. That's why it should be said that most of the design choices left to be perfected. DUSK is more of a good David Szymansky game than it is a good shooter. Overall, it's okay.

If it wasn't for YES/NO recommendation approach on Steam, I would've left OK review. I'm only setting it to negative because there are more chances someone will read this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878907374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1704253016}
review:
DUSK feels the closest to playing classic DOOM out of any new boomer shooter that's come out in recent years. It nails the action-horror aesthetic and gameplay while still being true to itself as its own game.

I'm not a fan of horror, and unfortunately for me there are 3 levels in particular that are especially scary, but now that I've played them I realize the best way to go through is just charge ahead and keep quicksaving. You only get more scared the slower you go!

This game is awesome, the music is awesome, and all the developers are awesome. Now go and inflict pain and gibbitude on those cultists!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004515240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1868, 'last_played': 1704151770}
review:
Do you like old school Boomer shooters like Doom, Blood, Duke Nukem & Quake? If you do, you'll absolutely love this game.

Controls and movement are phenomenal and the guns look, feel and sound punchy like they should. The monster roster is memorable & varied enough that there's surprises right up until the last few missions of the game. The difficulty is highly adjustable from very easy to one hit = instant death if you're really feeling masochistic.

The maps run the gamut of claustrophobic basements, sewers, open farm areas, mines to military bases and gothic castles & hellscapes and most have quite a bit of polish and love put into them. Dusk really feels like the Quake 1 sequel we should have gotten and the game itself is both a homage & parody of the genre while still doing its own eldritch horror thing.

Even better, the stellar soundtrack is done by Andrew Hulshult and is a surprisingly nuanced blend of ambience & adrenaline and is the perfect accompaniment to slaughter evil hordes of Lovecraftian nightmares.

There's plenty of secrets, multiple play modes like standard campaigns, endless waves and multiplayer if you want deathmatching (and yes, it plays just as frenetically as bunny hopping Quake!) and there's even a free HD texture pack if you don't care for the pixel/sprite look. Modding and level editing are also supported if you're into that kind of thing.

My only complaint about this game is that I didn't play it sooner!

Чтобы почувствовать настолько атмосферная эта игруха зайдите на ютуб-канал Хильшульта, который делал музыку к этой игре https://youtu.be/DKCrkg7Kcdc?si=HUwgOztQeRESYd8V и включите 51 минуту, да вы переслушаете весь альбом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284513805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6064, 'last_played': 1704061535}
review: Dusk is one of, if not the best retro-style shooters out there. The pace and flow are unmatched and the gameplay loop is about as rich and satisfying as I can imagine. The hellish themes and brutal action make you feel like you're playing Doom for the first time again. Dusk somehow manages to feel familiar yet original. It's as classic as it is new. It strikes a perfect balance between retro and modern gaming sensibilities, and doesn't ever fall flat. Dusk is not only one of the best indie shooters of the past decade, but one of the best shooters of the past decade period. This game will hopefully go down in history, and continue to astound gamers for years to come.

review:
Невероятно быстрый и очень отзывчивый бумер-шутер с изобретательными и разнообразными уровнями и полным отсутствием хитсканящих врагов, в котором ваш успех зависит исключительно от того, насколько точно и чётко вы управляете персонажем.
Одна из немногих игр по ту сторону киберспортивных дисциплин, которая полностью оправдает покупку монитора с частотой обновления матрицы в 180 герц и выше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963810920', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1705098680}
review:
Rating: 10/10
Dusk is a masterpiece no doubt about it. What makes Dusk standout out is not only the fantastic level design and enemy variety but also an interesting back story and satisfying gameplay. Dusk is to me some of the best of the best in the boomer shooter craze we have been having since this game. The atmosphere goes up a notch the more you go through the game and i loved that.  And it feels spooky and dark at times which was awesome.
Finding secrets can be fun and it's not as tedious as other games of this genre tend to be. And the fact the secret actual help out a lot also helps. I liked the soap in this game. It can decimate any boss with a single hit and i kinda like that. 
Each episode had it's own feeling and atmosphere. The foothills are there to get you familiar with movement and the game then the facilities are more of a test and a challenge to see how well you picked up on what you learned in the first episode and then the third episode puts you to the test of everything you learned. And it also ties wonderfully into one another it's kinda amazing how well overall the game is. There is not a single fault i had with it. And when i died it felt it was my mistake and no one else's. I am glad i finally managed to finish and beat this masterpiece of a game. I think it will be a classic for the decades to come and a game most people getting into boomer shooters will have to play first. It tried to imitate the classics of the 90s but it ended up creating it's own atmosphere and vibe that made it extremely unique. For any hardcore FPS fans this is a must play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158535736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1704360290}
review:
Gostei muito deste jogo.

A jogabilidade é bem rápida e divertida.

O jogo é bem variado: boa variedade de armas, inimigos e cenários.

Ele tem várias homenagens a clássicos do gênero FPS. Reconheci referências a jogos como Blood, Half-life, Heretic, Quake, entre outros.

Levei 8 horas para zerar na dificuldade I Can Take it, a normal do jogo.

*Obs: vá nas opções do jogo e deixe a deadzone do mouse em 0, isso deixa a jogabilidade muito mais precisa.

Muito bom, recomendo muito.

review: несмотря на свой огромнй опыт в этой игре, когда я взялся за последнюю ачивку задушило даже меня. Чтобы получить этот несчастный знак нужно помимо секретов убить ещё и всех врагов, что порой очень сильно бесит. Ближе к 25 часу игра очень приедается за счёт малого разнообразия в бестиарии и оружии, игру рекомендую, но буквально на одно прохождение.
